intro: Phymatopsis philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine phymatopsis, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody structure and shows a preference for moist, well-drained soils. It typically grows in lowland forests and is often found in secondary vegetation. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
